headline: Truckmaker PACCAR's first-quarter results slump on sluggish demand
summary: The company, grappling with an excess supply of equipment amid slower demand within the machinery market, is now facing fresh challenges from the ongoing trade war, which has thrown the automotive industry and its supply chains into disarray.  PACCAR, which makes trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF brands, lowered the industry retail sales forecast for its Class 8 trucks in the U.S. and Canada to between 235,000 and 265,000 in 2025, from its prior expectation of 250,000 to 280,000.  "The North American truck market is being affected by uncertain economic conditions and the impact of new tariffs," said Kevin Baney, executive vice president at the company.

headline: PACCAR Q1 Earnings Miss Expectations, Revenues Decline Y/Y
summary: PCAR reports lower-than-expected Q1 results and expects R&D expenses in the range of $450-$480 million compared to the previous estimate of $460-$500 million.

summary: Paccar (PCAR) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -7.01% and 2.28%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: PACCAR (NASDAQ:PCAR) Misses Q1 Sales Targets, Stock Drops
summary: Trucking company PACCAR (NASDAQ:PCAR) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 16% year on year to $6.91 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.46 per share was 7.5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: PACCAR Achieves Good Financial Performance and Record PACCAR Parts Revenue
summary: BELLEVUE, Wash., April 29, 2025--"PACCAR reported good revenues and net income in the first quarter of 2025," said Preston Feight, chief executive officer. "Peterbilt, Kenworth and DAF delivered good results, PACCAR Parts delivered record revenue and strong profits, and PACCAR Financial Services achieved good results due to its high-quality portfolio. I am very proud of our employees and dealers who have delivered outstanding trucks and transportation solutions to our customers."
